creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Dr and Mrs Sherman Lee
description: colorful landscape with narrow, gnarled mountains in orange, blue, green, and gray; small round thatched hut LLQ with figure in window; rocks with gnarled trees lower half; many dots indicating distant foliage on mountains and blossoms on trees
inscription:
poem 1: 独酌独酌花前　酒春風吹入懐　一閒吾願足百　事世相乖白首　人非舊青山骨　可埋誰知今日　楽只在澹生涯 {?} (Drinking alone, wine beside the  flowers, / Spring breezes fluttering the lapels of my robe. / With just this peace my desire is fulfilled, / while the world’s affairs leave me at odds. / White haired but not yet passed on,  / These green mountains a good place to take my bones. / Who understands that this happiness today / Lies simply in tranquillity of life?)
poem 2:
markings: poem UR red seal: 无心 {mushin} [mushin #2]; LC red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #1], 静處 {seisho} [seisho #1]; LR red seals: [unread #8], [unread #9], 字曰子徳 {azana iwaku shitoku}, 静處 {seisho} [seisho #2]; LLC red seal: 蓬莱山下人 {Hōraisan genin}
signed: poem 1: 古道人詩畫 {Kodōjin shiga}; poem 2: 丙寅如月碧翁又識 {hinoe-tora jogetsu Hekiō yūshiki}
title: Plum Blossom Library
